page.title: 11FARMING IN DEERNESS (2)
page.content: {Dairy}farming though less popular than beef production nevertheless provides a steady monthly income. Good ground with an all grass policy and 1 tonne of concentrate per cow per year yields an average 4000 to 4500 litres per cow. The{grazing season}lasts from May to October. In winter the cows are housed inside a double tied cowshed with round the shed milk pipeline. The main winter feed is silage together with concentrates. Milk is stored in a refrigerated bulk tank and is collected by Milk Marketing Board tanker and taken to the cheese making factory at{Kirkwall.}Pasteurised milk is sold at the retail shop. Since lst April 1984 milk production has been controlled by{quotas}through legislation introduced by the European Parliament.
